TopicTitle: Do I need a heat shield for Duna

Articles.Content: Title is self explanatory. I'm trying to land ships on Duna with DRE. But designing them with heat shields and still landing them is a pain. If I do need a heat shield, can I just use a fairing from Proc fairings instead of the ablatives? I want to land a few of my ships on their sides, so I need to protect the landing gear.

I have found that landing o Duna from a low orbit (50-75km up) results in little to no re-entry effects (stock, dunno about DRE). I think you can get away with no heat shield. Also, fairings, I believe, do not have higher heat tolerances than anything else (only the ablatives do). Their effectiveness (aside from attractiveness) is only with FAR.
If you can slow yourself down well enough before or while you re-enter, you might make it, but this is DRE we are talking about so you could quicksave and then YOLO it.

I've done a few Duna landings with DRE before, and I can confirm that if you're coming in from a decently low orbit, you don't really even need a heat shield at all unless you plan on doing some aerobraking as part of your initial orbital capture.
